name: nytimes
text: Harris became the first woman of color to be nominated for national office by a major party. Here are some other things to know about her. https://t.co/QdrjHkK3GW

name: nytimes
text: Here’s what to know about where Harris stands on the issues. https://t.co/LJrrQEz9Ej

name: nytimes
text: Harris embodies a shift in the U.S.: When her mother left India in 1958, the share of Americans who were immigrants was at its lowest point in a century. Today, more than a quarter of adults are immigrants or the U.S.-born children of immigrants. https://t.co/lTkvz2KBnh

name: nytimes
text: Harris’s values were shaped, in part, by her mother’s side of the family, which defied stereotypes in India and promoted equality for women. “She got that from her mother," an uncle said. "Shyamala always taught her: Don’t let anyone push you around.” https://t.co/gU0oMVbjdT

name: nytimes
text: Harris's father, Donald, has remained mostly in the background. But he spoke to @EllenBarryNYT after Kamala Harris was named to the Democratic ticket. https://t.co/5ta1bTT44N

name: nytimes
text: Harris's parents grew up under British colonial rule on different sides of the planet. They were each drawn to Berkeley, California, and became part of a Black intellectual circle that shaped the rest of their lives. https://t.co/6JQqBwOm2v

name: nytimes
text: As San Francisco district attorney, California attorney general and now a U.S. senator, Harris's politics were shaped by her upbringing among Berkeley activists. She later came to believe that working from inside the system had more power to make change. https://t.co/sMEclS78Uo

name: nytimes
